plants.name: Camellia japonica
plants.description: A hardy evergreen shrub known for its beautiful, large flowers that bloom in late winter to early spring. It thrives in temperate regions and is often cultivated in gardens for its ornamental value.
plants.location: East Asia, commonly cultivated in temperate gardens worldwide
plants.funFact: Camellias were the inspiration for the naming of the tea plant genus Camellia sinensis.

plants.name: Nerium oleander
plants.description: An evergreen shrub or small tree found in Mediterranean regions that blooms profusely even in winter mild climates, producing clusters of fragrant flowers.
plants.bloomingSeason: May to November, but in mild climates can bloom almost year-round including January
plants.funFact: All parts of the Oleander plant are extremely poisonous if ingested.

plants.name: Helleborus niger
plants.description: A perennial plant that blooms in the cold winter months, often around Christmas but can continue blooming into January. It is famous for flowering amid snow and frost.
plants.funFact: Despite the name, the Christmas Rose is not a true rose; its scientific family is Ranunculaceae.

plants.name: Acacia baileyana
plants.description: A fast-growing Australian native tree known for its bright yellow, fluffy flower heads that bloom in late winter, symbolizing the coming spring.
plants.location: Australia, also cultivated in Mediterranean and subtropical climates
plants.funFact: Wattles are an important source of pollen for native bees in Australia.
